channel.title: MMO project for fun [NOW RELEASED!]
channel.description:
PLAYNOW - [url=http://www.diamondhunt.co]www.diamondhunt.co/mmo/[/url] MORE Teaser:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/fO6qnMF.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/BGVGJQa.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/qDiQWus.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/L3RCYb6.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/fochTHv.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/kyLXOfM.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/4QguNyK.png[/img]
It's pretty bad, but meh. Doing it to learn and to have fun . :)

item.title: MMO project for fun [NOW RELEASED!]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“parkview, post:36, topic:544751”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665151.msg4446544#msg4446544 date=1409101702]

I actually think if you improved this more and moved away from an “idle” based game then you could get something going here. Played for a while and it needs major work but is a decent piece of work so far.

That’s what I’m saying, he should attempt to stick with one project until it’s basically finished. It would make things easier for him.
[/quote]
I really don’t plan on quitting this, it’s been nothing but success so far :)[/quote]
I don’t think either of us said anything about quitting. We(or I) were(was) just saying make one project a priority over the other(s).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’re that guy that made the diamond clicker lol right?
Between your site and your signature on here you got like 3 projects. Now I’m not saying you can’t manage that, but it would be easier to focus on one at a time
Most of the members here liked your diamond clicker and were waiting for you to add more features and such lol.

Haven’t tried the mmo but I’m not a fan of your site layout for it.

Read full topic

Actually looks pretty good. How did you do the equipping item sprites? Did you actually make multiple sprites for each item of clothing or weapon so it moves with the player animation?
[/quote] Yes, how else would it be done ?

if I understand right he’s asking if every single combination has its own sprite

layering the sprites would be the other way[/quote]

I am layering the sprites

item.title: MMO project for fun [NOW RELEASED!]
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.description:
@parkview wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:18, topic:544751”]calling it an MMO is a probably a bit ambitious if I’m honest. However it does look pretty cool, did you program this from scratch? more specfically the server client interactions and synchronising of the systems to make sure both maintin a valid copy of each other. If you did then this does look quite cool, the applications of having such an infratstructure allow you to make some cool things, for example if you’ve built this with the graphical engine completely exclusive to the actual game engine there’s no reason you couldn’t expand it to 3D.
Looks good (Y)[/quote]

Yeah from scratch. The server manages all the data while the client just draws the graphics from that data pulled from the server. This means that going 3d or whatever shouldn’t be a problem.

[quote=“Limits, post:14, topic:544751”]Actually looks pretty good. How did you do the equipping item sprites? Did you actually make multiple sprites for each item of clothing or weapon so it moves with the player animation?[/quote] Yes, how else would it be done ?

Read full topic

item.title: MMO project for fun [NOW RELEASED!]
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

calling it an MMO is a probably a bit ambitious if I’m honest. However it does look pretty cool, did you program this from scratch? more specfically the server client interactions and synchronising of the systems to make sure both maintin a valid copy of each other. If you did then this does look quite cool, the applications of having such an infratstructure allow you to make some cool things, for example if you’ve built this with the graphical engine completely exclusive to the actual game engine there’s no reason you couldn’t expand it to 3D.
Looks good (Y)

Read full topic
